page.title: 16 MOTOR TRANSPORT
page.content: In 1985 the motor car was the most important mode of transport for the population.In undertaking a traffic flow survey,the results obtained not only showed the volume of cars in usage but gave an insight into the affluence of today's society. The dependance upon the car is reflected in the fact that the majority of vehicles were recent models.In 1985, cars are dated by the registration plate which is unique to each vehicle and from this it is possible to obtain data.The survey revealed that between 13.00 and 14.45 hrs,18% of cars were 1984/85 registered.This compared with 9% which were 1978/79 registered and only 7% were registered as being older than 1974/75. The most popular car was the hatchback.
